command_group: az monitor log-analytics workspace table search-job
description: Manage tables for log analytics workspace search results table.

commands.name: az monitor log-analytics workspace table search-job cancel
commands.summary: Cancel a log analytics workspace search results table query run.
commands.syntax:
az monitor log-analytics workspace table search-job cancel [--ids]
                                                           [--name]
                                                           [--resource-group]
                                                           [--subscription]
                                                           [--workspace-name]
examples: az monitor log-analytics workspace table search-job cancel --resource-group MyResourceGroup --workspace-name MyWorkspace -n MyTable_SRCH

commands.name: az monitor log-analytics workspace table search-job create
commands.summary: Create a Log Analytics workspace search results table. The table name needs to end with '_SRCH'.
commands.syntax:
az monitor log-analytics workspace table search-job create --end-search-time
                                                           --name
                                                           --resource-group
                                                           --search-query
                                                           --start-search-time
                                                           --workspace-name
                                                           [--limit]
                                                           [--no-wait]
                                                           [--retention-time]
                                                           [--total-retention-time]
examples: az monitor log-analytics workspace table search-job create --resource-group MyResourceGroup --workspace-name MyWorkspace -n MyTable_SRCH --retention-time 45 --search-query "Heartbeat | where SourceSystem != '' | project SourceSystem" --limit 1000 --start-search-time "Sat, 28 Aug 2021 05:29:18 GMT" --end-search-time "Sat, 28 Aug 2021 08:29:18 GMT"
